scriptsComments.lint: run eslint on all typescript files.  --fix is to auto-fix the code if possible
scriptsComments.start: running `npm run start` in the terminal will run the code for the various coding challenges.  Specifying --transpile-only skips the type-checking that would otherwise occur when running `ts-node` and speeds up the execution

devDependenciesComments.@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin: I believe this contains the actual typescript eslint rules.  This is installed alongside @typescript-eslint/parser and must have the same version number
devDependenciesComments.@typescript-eslint/parser: allows eslint to parse typescript code
devDependenciesComments.eslint: allows our code to be linted against a particular set of code rules
devDependenciesComments.eslint-config-prettier: (only) turns off all eslint rules that interfere with prettier rules
devDependenciesComments.eslint-plugin-prettier: converts prettier rules into eslint rules
devDependenciesComments.prettier: opinionated code formatting rules for eslint
devDependenciesComments.ts-node: allows nodejs to run typescript files
